alert.note: Alert for Jewell; Mitchell; Osborne; Phillips; Rooks; Smith (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued October 13 at 3:50PM CDT until October 14 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...Critical Fire Weather Conditions Expected Today and Across Portions of the Area Friday... ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR SOUTH CENTRAL NEBRASKA AND PORTIONS OF NORTH CENTRAL KANSAS... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 8 PM CDT FRIDAY FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR PORTIONS OF SOUTH CENTRAL NEBRASKA GENERALLY ALONG AND SOUTH OF A GOTHENBURG TO AURORA TO GENEVA LINE AND INCLUDING NORTH CENTRAL KANSAS... The National Weather Service in Hastings has issued a Red Flag Warning for wind and low relative humidity, which is in effect from noon to 8 PM CDT Friday. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * WINDS...Today, Northwest sustained 20 to 30 mph, with gusts 40 to 50 mph. On Friday, West sustained 15 to 25 mph, with gusts 30 to 40 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...For today, as low as 15 to 20 percent. On Friday, as low as 18 to 25 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that ignite may spread rapidly and exhibit extreme fire behavior. Use extreme caution if engaging in activities that could result in fire ignition.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: Jewell; Mitchell; Osborne; Phillips; Rooks; Smith
